data.title: Rotterdam Square on LinkedIn: #rotterdamsquare #ecosystem #startup #award
data.meta_description: Rotterdam start-up IMcoMET received the Next Frontier Award from Erasmus Enterprise! 🎉 The award was presented during the 2023 Entrepreneurial Year Opening…
data.text:
Open call for PPP Programs by Health~Holland! Health~Holland invites parties to establish innovative #research programs with the aim of developing sustainable, innovative products and services within the Life Sciences & Health sector through public-private partnerships (#PPP), contributing to the economic growth of the Netherlands. Approximately €40 million in PPP subsidies is available for this purpose. Within a program, the organizing parties are given the opportunity to select PPP projects for the relevant PPP subsidy that contribute to the goals of the Top Sector Life Sciences & Health. Core conditions of this call: ▪ At least two independent Dutch entities organize the program. ▪ Program budget ranges from €500k to €5 million per program year for one to three consecutive years. ▪ Projects must meet Health~Holland’s PPP conditions. ▪ Program applications are assessed based on Relevance, Impact, Quality of collaboration, and Approach. 🔔 The submission deadline is Friday, November 1, 2024, 17:00 CET. For more information about applying, please visit the Health~Holland website: https://lnkd.in/eqacw-CW #RotterdamSquare #ecosystem #lifesciences #health #funding #innovation

𝐌𝐞𝐞𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐧𝐞𝐭𝐰𝐨𝐫𝐤! 🌐 The Rotterdam Life Sciences & Health #ecosystem is a dynamic network of companies, service providers, educational institutes, healthcare providers, and more, working together to #innovate in #healthcare. As Rotterdam Square, we would like you to get to know our partners in this network. Today, we introduce you to Varsha Thakoersing, CEO and co-founder of IMcoMET. Varsha is a scientist who transitioned into #entrepreneurship. She co-founded IMcoMET, a #medtech start-up at the forefront of revolutionizing personalized treatment in #dermatological care with their innovative M-Duo Technology®, focusing on prevalent conditions like atopic dermatitis and psoriasis. “My career is fueled by my childhood aspiration to make a significant impact in healthcare, which guided me towards an academic and professional path in bio-pharmaceutical sciences.” ▶ Read the full story on our website: https://lnkd.in/g6vH48Ym 📰 Subscribe to our newsletter for more stories like this: https://lnkd.in/gUquWT9J #RotterdamSquare #ecosystem #lifesciences #health #tech

Pan Cancer T is an innovative #immunotherapy spin-off of Erasmus MC, located in the Erasmus MC Incubator in the Rotterdam Science Tower and on campus. The company’s products are based on TCR-T therapy, a form of T cell therapy that exploits the abilities of T cells - the primary natural immune effector cell - to recognize and kill tumor cells. Working on a unique set of targets, engineering T cells for enhanced durability, and recently securing funding for further development from Health~Holland and KWF Kankerbestrijding, Pan Cancer T is on the verge to change immunotherapy. CEO Rachel Abbott: “It is this combination of novel targets and additional engineering to overcome immune suppression, that makes us unique.” 📰 Read the full interview with Pan Cancer T about their story and mission on our website: https://lnkd.in/enJKijjn #RotterdamSquare #ecosystem #lifesciences #health #startup | Technology Transfer Office (TTO) – Erasmus MC

Delta Life Science, a leader in label-free, multiplexed biosensing, has launched their new product inQuiQ™! “The inQuiQ™ allows scientists to conduct highly sensitive, multiplexed analyses with sample volumes from 10 µl to 2 ml on a reusable photonic sensor. Taking up only an A3 paper-size space in a laboratory, the compact inQuiQ™ gives you real-time data with improved 16-plex measurements in serum, plasma, and supernatant.” Delta Life Science, formerly known as Delta Diagnostics, is located in the Erasmus MC Incubator in the Rotterdam Science Tower. The company is committed to revolutionizing #biosensing technology by an innovative approach to reduce the complexity and cost of traditional lab methods, making it accessible to all. By providing a rapid, sensitive, low-cost solution, Delta Life Science aims to empower #researchers and #industry professionals to make groundbreaking advancements in Life Sciences. Congratulations Delta Life Science on this successful next step in your mission! Great to have you in the Rotterdam ecosystem 🚀 Read the full press release here: https://lnkd.in/eQePxk4r #RotterdamSquare #ecosystem #lifesciences #health #tech #launch #innovation

Are you a #student or future #entrepreneur with a passion for innovation and healthcare? Together with University of Oxford and Universidade de Coimbra, TU Delft has set up a new 5 ECTS health #innovation training program funded by EIT Health, with the aim to support the next generation of health technology innovators. If you want to make a meaningful contribution to society and learn skills that will accelerate your career, then this program is for you! You will directly learn from industry leaders and serial entrepreneurs, participate in skills and training workshops, and have the opportunity to work with experienced mentors to pitch your ideas to a panel of experts and investors. 🔔 This course is open to all students, and a blend of online as well as onsite classes at the University of Oxford starting September 2024. Application is open until August 19. Sign up now! ▶ For more information, please visit the EIT Health website: https://lnkd.in/e5Rw4edR #RotterdamSquare #ecosystem #training #course #healthcare #business

Last week, we hosted our annual #RotterdamSquare summer drinks event at Dudok aan de Maas! Thank you to everyone who joined us - we hope you enjoyed the presentations, the informal, cozy atmosphere during the drinks afterwards, and the sunny weather ☀ Our managing director Ellen Smit shared the first results from the survey that was recently distributed in our network. Learning more about the experiences, ideas and suggestions from our network, will help us improve and tailor our activities. The full report will soon be available on our website. A big thank you to Maheep Gupta and Marvin Kunz for joining us at the #event to pitch your exciting company Daksha. Daksha is a start-up in the Rotterdam network, using #AI and Process Automation to help companies improve productivity by taking care of their ‘trivial tasks’. Very interesting to learn more about how Daksha has successfully helped many companies in Life Sciences & Health! And thank you Carola Immerzeel-Goosens and Pedro Barbosa Tinnemans from the Technology Transfer Office (TTO) – Erasmus MC, for presenting the plans of the new Erasmus MC Incubator and the first insights into the Validation Program the TTO will be offering to start-ups in the network. And a special congratulations to Carola on 25 years of working at Erasmus MC! 🎉 🔔 This was our last event before the summer holiday. We will be back on August 29 with our next event: a sport activity! Save the date in your calendar. If you want to see more upcoming events, please take a look on our website: https://lnkd.in/eCqiXQP6
